ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Request headers of existing browsers/crawlers?
ygData.msgSnippet: As I understand it, the largest header Mercator will set is: GET /foo.html HTTP/1.0 User-Agent: Mercator-1.0 Host: foo.com From:

As I understand it, the largest header Mercator will set is:

GET /foo.html HTTP/1.0
User-Agent: Mercator-1.0
Host: foo.com
From: http://www.research.digital.com/SRC/mercator/
Accept: <a crawl parameter>
If-Modified-Since: <download date of lastime we crawled this page>


Notes:

* Mercator can use proxies, in which case the first line would be slightly different

* We claimed 1.0 version of the protocol because when Mercator was written 1.1 wasn't very common

* Mercator doesn't support cookies (although AVista added this internally)

* "Accept" and "If-Modified-Since" are OPTIONAL, and in practice we seldom used them.

* User-Agent and From could be changed as crawl paremters.  I would often use something like:

  User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; Mercator-1.0)

Also, for Archive crawls I'd often use "User-Agent: IAArchiver" or
something like that.
